section.p: This section describes the parameters required to create an account. Log into the SM GUI, navigate to Subscriber Manager> Accounts tab.
To add an account, click , add the basic details, associations, and custom data to the account as described in the given table:

entry.p: Parameter
Description
Options
Mandatory/ Optional

row.entry: This parameter indicates a unique identifier or name for the account randomly generated by the system.
A string of up to 255 characters
This parameter indicates the type of account for billing purposes.

entry.p: Select either of the account type from the drop-down list:

row.entry: This parameter indicates the timezone used for the billing cycle.
This parameter indicates the hour of the day selected for that account.

entry.p: The integer can be configured as follows:

li.p: 0— equal to 0:00 and indicates the beginning of the day (default)
1 to 23— equal to the hours 01:00 to 23:00 for any time during the day

ul.li: Exact - If selected, the end date and time has the same time as subscription start time.

Start of new day - If selected, the end date and time is aligned to 00:00:00 of next day as per the lifecycle periodicity. For example, if a monthly subscription is purchased on 20th February 13:45:00, then the end date and time of subscription is set to 21st March 00:00:00.

row.entry: This parameter is used for monthly resets and represents the day of the month that the usage is reset. You must also configure the Hour of Day parameter to the time of day that you want the reset to occur.

entry.p: Day of Month, Day of Week, and Hour of Day combined make up the billing cycle.
The integer can be configured as follows:

ul.li: Exact - If selected, the day of month is aligned to subscription purchase date.

entry.p: The default value is 1.

row.entry: This parameter is used for weekly resets and has no affect on monthly resets.

entry.p: You must also configure the Hour of Day parameter to the time of day that you want the reset. The day of the week to reset can be one of:

ul.li:
Exact -
If selected, the day of week is aligned to subscription purchase date.

entry.p: If no value is provided, the system sets the 'dayOfWeek' to the current day of the week when the account is created.

row.entry:
This parameter is used to define a list of bill cycle dates. The next bill cycle happens on the next value defined in the calendar. For example, if current end date is 12/01/20, then after next renew the end date can be set to 01/03/20, if it is defined in the calendar.
If an account is created with bill cycle calendar reference, it takes priority over billing information and periodicity of periodic lifecycle, and the end date is set from the calendar. All the subscriptions renewed via account lifecycle align to the new date.

Drop-down list.
To configure a new bill cycle calendar, refer to section Bill Cycle calendar in the Charging User Guide.

entry.p: This parameter specifies the overage limit on the main balance. 19.3 It can be used to define prepaid and postpaid subscriber as follows:

li.p: Prepaid Subscriber with Minimum Balance as Zero, that is, Overage limit is defined as ZERO. Account balance cannot go below ZERO.

Prepaid Subscriber with Minimum Balance allowed to go to configurable negative credit, such as -50 USD. Here, the Overage limit is defined as 50 (that is, -50). Account balance cannot go below -50 USD.

Postpaid subscriber with a credit limit such as 500 USD (controlled postpaid). Here, the account balance is kept as ZERO and Overage Limit is kept as 500 USD (that is, -500). Account balance cannot go below - 500 USD.
Postpaid subscriber with no credit limit (uncontrolled postpaid). Here, the account balance is kept as ZERO and Overage Limit is not defined. Hence, its limited to -9999999999.

entry.p: Double
If overage = 0.0, the overage feature is disabled for that particular account.
If overage is not configured during creation, then Account is created with a value of -9999999999D as the overageLimit, meaning that it is unlimited.
The valid range of the overageLimit is 0.0 to -9999999999D.
The overageLimit cannot be positive.
The account balance can never go below the overageLimit value.
